notice.title: Notice
notice.content:
### 1. Oral Presentation

- Presentation materials (PPT) should be prepared on a USB memory drive. (Beam projector will be used)
- Presentation time: 15 minutes for talk, 5 minutes for Q&A (Total 20 minutes)
- Please strictly adhere to the scheduled presentation time.

### 2. Poster Presentation

- We recommend printing one A1 size (vertical) sheet.
- Presenters should prepare a 3-5 minute summary explanation.
- If A1 printing is difficult, you may print and attach 10 PPT slides.
- Poster session duration is 120 minutes. Please note that if you leave your poster unattended, it may be marked as 'No Show' and potentially unpublished.
- You should stay by your poster to answer questions from participants.

### 3. Video Presentation

- **Production Method:** Create a video of approximately 15 minutes using PPT recording, ZOOM, or OBS where the PPT screen is shown in full.
- **Resolution:** 1920X1080 recommended (minimum 1280X720)
- **File Size:** Maximum 150MB

call-for-papers/call-for-conference-pape.title: Call for Conference Paper
call-for-papers/call-for-conference-pape.content:
### Paper Submission Guidelines

- Maximum length: 2 pages (short paper) or 3-4 pages (regular paper).
- Format: A4 size, single space, double column, Times New Roman font (size 10).
- Accepted papers will be published by Springer in the **Communications in Computer and Information Science (CCIS)** series.
- Springer CCIS is indexed in SCOPUS, EI Compendex, etc.

At least one author of each accepted paper must present the paper at the conference.

[Submit your paper via Microsoft CMT](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/MITA2025)

call-for-papers/call-for-journal-paper.title: Call for Journal Paper
call-for-papers/call-for-journal-paper.content:
### Journal Track (JMIS)

We are pleased to announce a special Journal Track for MITA 2025, in collaboration with the Journal of Multimedia Information System (JMIS).

#### Dual Publication Track

Papers submitted to this track will undergo peer review for potential publication in JMIS. Authors of accepted papers will be invited to give oral presentations at MITA 2025, and only the abstracts will appear in the MITA proceedings. Full papers will be published in JMIS.

[Go to JMIS Submission Site](https://www.manuscriptlink.com/journals/jmis) (Ensure to select 'MITA 2025 Journal Track' as submission type)

keynotes.title: Communications and Networking in Mega-Constellations
keynotes.speaker: Prof. Gunes Karabulut Kurt
keynotes.abstract: The wide footprint of satellites holds the promise of providing ubiquitous connectivity. However, challenges persist in overcoming bottlenecks to ensure sufficiently high data rates for under-connected communities while maintaining uninterrupted communication. This talk identifies these challenges regarding communications and networking perspectives, summarizes recent research efforts addressing them, and highlights key open issues for future investigation.
keynotes.biography: Gunes Karabulut-Kurt is a Canada Research Chair (Tier 1) in New Frontiers in Space Communications and a Professor at Polytechnique Montreal, Montreal, QC, Canada. She is the Director of the Poly-Grames Research Center, and is co-founder and Director of Education and Training of ASTROLITH, Transdisciplinary Research Unit of Space Resource and Infrastructure Engineering at Polytechnique Montreal. She is also an adjunct research professor at Carleton University, Canada. Gunes received the B.S. degree with high honors in electronics and electrical engineering from Bogazici University, Istanbul, Turkiye, in 2000 and the M.A.Sc. and the Ph.D. degrees in electrical engineering from the University of Ottawa, ON, Canada, in 2002 and 2006, respectively. She worked in different technology companies in Canada and Turkiye between 2005 and 2010. From 2010 to 2021, she was a professor at Istanbul Technical University. Gunes is a Marie Curie Fellow and has received the Turkish Academy of Sciences Outstanding Young Scientist (TUBA-GEBIP) Award in 2019.

keynotes.title: Trustworthy AI for Multimedia Systems
keynotes.speaker: Prof. Minji Park
keynotes.abstract: This talk explores practical approaches to building trustworthy AI pipelines for multimedia applications, focusing on transparency, robustness, and evaluation across real-world datasets.
keynotes.biography: Minji Park is a professor at KAIST. Her research spans explainable AI, multimedia understanding, and human-centered evaluation. She has published widely and serves on multiple program committees.

keynotes.title: Edge-to-Cloud Media Processing
keynotes.speaker: Dr. Alex Chen
keynotes.abstract: We present a scalable edge-to-cloud architecture for low-latency media analytics and discuss deployment strategies for heterogeneous networks.
keynotes.biography: Alex Chen leads the Systems and Networking Lab at NTU, working on distributed systems for multimedia, IoT, and networking.

keynotes.title: Human-Computer Interaction in Immersive Media
keynotes.speaker: Prof. Sofia Martinez
keynotes.abstract: This keynote reviews interaction design patterns for immersive media experiences and highlights emerging opportunities for inclusive design.
keynotes.biography: Sofia Martinez is a professor at UQ focusing on HCI and immersive media. She has led multiple industry collaborations in AR/VR.
